Reviews.Title: “Great bar, dreary rooms, fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: masonfamily99
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading some of the other reviews, primarily because of its location (close to Central Station). The bar is really friendly and a great place to meet locals and travellers alike. We had a room in the attic (en-suite) and yes the stairs are steep and narrow but this is not unusual in Amsterdam especially the old part. Our room was a decent size and has everything you need for a short stay (we stayed 4 nights). It was reasonably clean but very dark and dreary, everything was painted a strange shade of green. It is a good choice for younger people because it's cheap compared to other hotels in this area, we are in our fifties and managed the stairs with no problems. It does get noisy of a Friday and Saturday night but wasn't so bad that you couldn't sleep. Would I stay here again? Yes I probably would.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel knowing it would be loud and in the centre of everything. We arrived early at 10.30am and weren't able to check in until the afternoon but the owners let us leave our trolley bag near the bar. We walked around, had lunch then went back to hotel for a beer. Checked into room about 1pm. We had room 32 which is a superior room with jacuzzi bath. Top floor and the steps are STEEP. This hotel was excellent value for money, in the heart of everything and we would definitely stay here again. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “The dam 2012”
Reviews.Author: Gadge12
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel internationaal for 3 nites in march was our 2nd trip to amsterdam and whatta place to stay . Rooms have everythin u need ( beds tv wadrobe chairs and ashtray) smoking is allowed in your room (weed) hotels location is unbeleiveable coffee shops bars restaurants everything is within walkin distance . Can be a little noisy at nite but theyres earpluggs provided but in truth we slept no problem . Hotel internationaal was a great baisic but clean and will definetly return here hopefully in the near future

Reviews.Title: “More than expected”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: What an ideal basic hotel!we stayed for 1 night for 55 euro.the owners and staff are very welcoming and friendly.the rooms were basic but fine for 1 night.shared bathroom was lovely and clean with plenty of room.location was great 5 min walk from central station.slighty noiseu at night but they supply ear plugs for free!be warned the steps are steep up to the rooms but your gunna get that your in Amsterdam!would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Really friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are really friendly and helpful. The location is ideal and the hotel has a relaxed fun feel to it. Couldn't have asked for more for the price. We were all really happy and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Break”
Reviews.Author: Hilary H Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had a very enjoyable stay in this hotel . basic but clean. Location was excellent. will definately stay here again . Have always stayed outside the main drag, better class hotels but the location makes up for this .

Reviews.Title: “Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: Fifer1903 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good value,very central location,friendly & helpful staff,compact but clean room.Ideal for a short stay.Great traditional bar .Only minus points would be-a very steep staircase leading to rooms,ok for us but unsuitable for anyone with mobility restrictions.Also due to the location there was a fair bit of external noise,although the hotel had thoughtfully provided earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Hayley D
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not complete luxury but it is clean, simple and comforatble. Staff are friendly and welcoming, the bar is cosy and traditional, however be careful on the stairs as they are typically steep !! Our room was facing the Warmoesstraat, buzzing part of the centre... however as Amsterdam never sleeps it was sometimes a little loud when we were trying to get to sleep at 5am... very much our own fault as we went for Amsterdam Dance Event. Perfect little hotel for travellers, you could do better if your wish to spend a lot more, but you could do a lot worse !

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel - no nonsense!”
Reviews.Author: mcginnmichelle
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at Hotel Internationaal and youâ€™ve gotta love this hotel. So itâ€™s not the Ritz but who wants to stay in the Ritz when in Amsterdam, here you are right in the middle of it all! Although this is a no nonsense hotel its clean, which is my one stipulation! Located on Warmoesstraat (one of the main streets that runs through the RLD) it does get a little noisy, especially early in the morning when the streets are being cleaned, but the hotel provides you with ear plugs. We stayed in the deluxe room on the top floor, it has a bit of a sitting area and a great Jacuzzi bath! The stairs are steep but youâ€™re in Amsterdam thatâ€™s just the way they roll! Our room was cleaned everyday and this is also a smoker friendly hotel, you just have to open a window. We have just re-booked for Feb so they must be doing something right!

Reviews.Title: “Ewww!”
Reviews.Author: SThomas1337
Reviews.Content: My husband read good reviews about this hotel and booked it as a surprise vacation for my 30th birthday. The bar is small and cute and the bartender was nice. The stairs up to the rooms are interesting but also pretty dangerous because they are so steep. Pack lightly if you plan on staying here. We entered the first floor landing and my first view was of some half naked guy laying in bed smoking with his room door wide open. The smell of smoke and sweat coming out of there made me want to gag. We got into our room and I was slightly shocked. My poor husband immediately apologized. The room is in desperate need of a refurbishment. The carpets are old and dirty, the furniture is old and beat up. There are dirty marks and dings all over the pukey colored walls. We had to share a toilet and shower with the other people on our floor. I had to clean urine off of the toilet numerous times and the toilet always smelled like urine - probably because the men staying there were pissing all over the place. The shower was reasonably clean. It was quite warm in the room so we had to keep the window open. There is constant noise coming from outside that goes on 24/7. The location was good because we could walk to all of the attractions, however, there were many shady looking characters in the area who would make lude comments to us to get our attention to sell us drugs. The restaurants in the area mostly consist of kebab type shops. The bartender let us leave our bags at the hotel on our last day until our flight in the afternoon. We still had a great time in Amsterdam despite the dodgy hotel. Next time we travel in Europe, we will paying extra to get a nicer room. The cost was still high in my opinion for staying in a place where you were scared to walk on the carpet without shoes and didn't want to touch the wall beside your bed with any part of your body! We went home with bug bites which I hope to hell weren't bed bugs. We kept our bags out of our room and washed everything when we got home. I don't know how this place gets good reviews. Maybe my standards are higher than others.

Reviews.Title: “OK for 1 or 2 nights”
Reviews.Author: akimaki
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located, near Central Station and City Center. The rooms are just above an old bar. Therefore it is very noisy until at leat 3AM even on weekdays. Rooms are very ran down, and very small. I recommend this hotel if you are in Amsterdam for partying . The price is low compared to other hotels in the area. Worth the value if you don't expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “Expect to get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: kylejoe82
Reviews.Content: This is a cheap hotel, and you get what you pay for. Do not book here if you want plush, or top class etc. Its basic, and is fine if you just want somewhere to get your head down for a couple of nights after getting drunk or stoned.

Reviews.Title: “Much room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Belfasttravellers
Reviews.Content: This is our eleventh trip to Amsterdam over the last few years. Weâ€™ve stayed in a variety of hotels and are familiar with hospitality standards in Amsterdam. I travelled with my partner, and two friends. We stayed in the top floor of Hotel Internaational for four nights. Both rooms have an ensuite â€“ one of which had a jacuzzi bath. We had read many positive reviews on this hotel and we were looking forward to the visit. The hotel is marketed as a â€˜budget hotelâ€™ so I wasnâ€™t expecting much. Just hot running water, a good shower and someplace comfortable to sleep. Unfortunately the hotel offered none of these. We paid extra for an en-suite room which we couldnâ€™t use. The bath/Jacuzzi did NOT HAVE ANY TAPS and had to be filled with the shower head. This took nearly a long time. When it eventually was filled the hotel manager told us it was leaking into the room downstairs. After the first night we did not have hot water in the mornings. The Hotel Manager told us to wait 20 minutes and try again. But there only seemed to be hot water for showers in the evening and night times. The general feel of the room was that it was in desperate need for repair. The furniture was worn and tatty and one of the chairs was broken. The curtains had fallen down and were â€˜tiedâ€™ onto a string. The carpet had also seen better days. The double bed was two â€˜guest bedsâ€™ (similar to what you might have stored away at home), set into a wooden box with a mattress on top. It wasnâ€™t very comfortable. On the positive side, the room was quite large. Smoking was allowed in the rooms and the Hotel Manager and the cleaning lady were all very pleasant and welcoming. The Bar downstairs is really cosy and had that â€˜old-worldâ€™ Dutch feel to it. Itâ€™s location is five minutes (or less) from the railway station which is great, and its right in one of the best areas for coffee-shops. If this hotel spend a little money on re-decoration and repair, and sorted out its plumbing problems then it would be a little gem, unfortunately is still got a long way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, didn't love the noise”
Reviews.Author: travelnut718
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel, the staff, the rooms, etc. Clean rooms, mellow staff, cute bar, convenient. If you plan to go to Amsterdam strictly to party, then this place is perfect. Walking distance to the train station and right in the heart of the red light district. Unfortunately, the noise of the red light district does make its way it the rooms and if I ever go back to Amsterdam (which hopefully I will because it is a GORGEOUS city) I will probably not stay there based on the location alone. Otherwise, I totally recommend this for young backpackers and party animals.

Reviews.Title: “deffinately my hotel of choice for futuretrips to amsterdam - perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: spookyali
Reviews.Content: hotel internationall has a really 'olde worlde' pub feel with a warm reception from the very poite staff, serving a nice selection of beers and a great pace to start your attack on amsterdam! The stairs up to the rooms are comicaly steep! but worth the climb as the room was the best weve stayed in out of 11 trips so far to this fantastic city!! (worth paying a little extra for the room with the jacuzzi in the atic!) All in all a lovely hotel, highly recomended and will return in feburary.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel in Amsterdam with great location”
Reviews.Author: Rob S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 2 nights at the Hotel Internationaal in mid-September, 2010. Room size: Small but big enough. The room contained a bed for two, a sink, a wardrobe, and a desk. Cleanliness: The room and bathroom were clean. Since smoking is allowed in the rooms there is a definite strong marijuana odor. The 2nd story room is nice since you can leave the windows open to air it out. Bathroom: Bedroom has a sink with mirror. The single shared toilet on our floor was in its own small wc. The shared shower is in its own room. The shower room has only one shower but is large enough for multiple people to fit if you want to save time ;-). The shower room is lockable so you basically are showering in a private room. Great water pressure and plenty of warm water. Location: This hotel is in a great location above a bar. It is maybe a 5-minute walk from the main train station (though it took us about 30-minutes because we got lost so pay attention!). The hotel is right on the edge of the red light district as shown by the red lights that pop up out of the ground right in front of the hotel at night. We did not take any public transportation while in Amsterdam. We walked everywhere (Anne Frank House, Van Gogh Museum, etc.) in roughly 30-minutes. Miscellaneous: Stairs up to the rooms are very steep, almost vertical. Since the hotel is above a bar, you check in with the bartender (who was very nice). Annoying alarm would beep in the hallway every time we would exit our room at night to use the bathroom but it would turn off after a few seconds. Free wifi. Not easy to find a spot to hang a clothesline in the room if you are doing laundry in the sink. Noise from the bar/street below was as we expected and not too bad. Summary: I recommend this hotel for budget-minded travelers who want a clean, conveniently-located place in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: LIfeIsTravel86
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic! Low price, clean and deasant rooms. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “convenient and welcoming - all you need in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: noplacelikehome05
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Internationaal in June this year - our first time in Amsterdam. This hotel is conveniently located as a base to explore all of Amsterdam's tourist sites - including the red light district. It is a very short walk from the train/bus terminal and easy to find. Staff were very friendly and welcoming - helping us with tourist maps, etc. Basic accommodation but secure enough - all you need in amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: RustyCatLeeds
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 1 night before travelling to a music festival 200 miles south of Amsterdam. The location is excellent, right on the corner of the red light district so close to lots of bars & coffee shops and you're within walking distance of most attractions (apart from museum district). If you only want the hotel to get your hed down on a night then its fine but not great. We were in the attic room which was a decent size but a bit of a dump. I would expect to pay about Â£50 for a room like this so 80 Euros was a bit much, but that is quite cheap for Amsterdam i suppose. All in all, if you're not fussy about the hotel and you only want it to sleep & shower then this hotel is for you,it probably is value for money for Amsterdam standards but defintiely expensive for what it is

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location, Good fun - Adapt & enjoy the differences.”
Reviews.Author: casagodfrey
Reviews.Content: For a few days in Amsterdam this place is spot on. The bar is great and the staff are great - they also seem to make up a large part of the customer base when they are not working! Rooms and stairs are typical of central Amsterdam - it is why you come to places like this - to experience the difference. Just enjoy it! Ensuite room had a quirky layout and was cleaned every day. Swipe card access to rooms and also swipe card access to accomodation via separate street door, if preferred. Security camera at base of magnificently precipitous staircase. With regard to other reviewers comments on the staircase - I have a screwed up leg and I coped with little difficulty (but lots of hilarity). We were two couples in our late 40's/50's and this is our third trip to Amsterdam in the last 10 years. Without doubt, we would return here. Bars & restaurants on doorstep, boat trips/ canal bus/ trains, less than 5 minutes walk. We loved the place and it's lively, happy, atmosphere. My wife used the provided ear plugs but the problem is not in-house. It is more to do with the acoustics of the narrow streets. I did not need them, nor did our friends. If you are a bit precious, then there are things to whine about. If you are a normal well adjusted traveller - you will smile and enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great price, clean, awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: mysfyt066
Reviews.Content: The entire staff of hotel and pub were extremely helpful and friendly! Helped us sort out trams and find different locals. Above a pub and a main street in the red light so they include ear plugs with your room which is a great help! The rooms are clean but small and beds not the most comfortable, but if you are in Amsterdam to sleep then you are going to the wrong place! The pub on the first floor was great! Very nice for meeting up with friends and for having a few drinks before heading out into the city. The orange juice was delicious :) The location was the best we have stayed in Amsterdam and will be staying here every time we go back! Literally a 5 minute walk from central station. A coffee shop was around each corner, canals and shops surrounding it. If you are in Amsterdam for a good time and want to stay in the heart of it all this is the place to book!

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for 1 night.. nothing special though”
Reviews.Author: Old_Gregg_9
Reviews.Content: Pros: Very friendly staff, no restaurant food as such but cheap snacks. Sits on top of a pub so theres beer. Very close to the train station which is why I chose it. Had a double room which was 70e. Shared shower and toilet, although right outside the door. Also security swipe card which I appreciated. Good enough for 1 night dont know i would want to stay for a few nights tho. Cons: Room itself was pretty dodge, clean enough and all, just a bit crap looking. Also noisy as this backs onto the red light disctrict and central Amsterdam. Also they let guests smoke (whatever they want) in the rooms so the room smelt a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: thebritishpike
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the En-Suite room on the top floor (the stairs are steep but that is just typical of Dutch buildings!). Good spacious room, windows fully open to get fresh air into the room. Toilet/Bathroom was new and clean with a whirlpool bath. Excellenty location, right by Amsterdam Central station and a 5-minute walk from Dam Square. Will be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location”
Reviews.Author: rebecca1234
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic for money. we booked through laterooms.com and found the hotel to be well worth the money.We only stayed in the hotel to sleep. The hotel is 2 mins from the central station from the airport and also in walking distance of everything - the shops the restaurants, red light district. recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great, just average”
Reviews.Author: hescaravage
Reviews.Content: We booked this room after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. Most of them were right on the money. It's central, close to the trams and the train station. Also near shopping and restaurants and close, but not too close, to the Red Light District. There is no elevator, so we trucked our bags up 3 flights of the narrowest stairs I've ever seen! The room was sectioned off into a bedroom, toilet room and bathroom. The bed was huge! But the pillows were lumpy and the toilet stank up our entire room. The shower flooded, but hotel staff cleaned it up almost right away. Noise was definitely an issue, we had a hard time sleeping and there was no phone or alarm clock to help us wake up. Would I recommend this place to my young backpacking friends? Yes. Would I recommend it to my parents? No.

Reviews.Title: “Seedy”
Reviews.Author: groovyb
Reviews.Content: The lobby is a bar. The bartenders were very nice and helpful. We stayed in a "double room". The bed was 2 singles in a double bed frame, so the two beds separate and you fall in between. The steps are very narrow and hard to get up and down, but you kinda get used to it. The shower was clean and new looking. The room though was very dark and dingey. The light was a very low wattage so it looked like a crack den. I didn't feel as though the bedroom was very clean or that I felt clean staying there. In Amsterdam, if you have the money, I'd say spend more and stay nicer. The location was very good though, about 5 mins from Central Station and right in the Red Light District.

Reviews.Title: “Atmospheric central Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Writetoroam
Reviews.Content: They have a safe for passports etc. Bar staff are lovely and speak perfect English. Secure with key cards. Located a couple of streets from the Red Light District's girls, so if you don't want to see them you don't have to. If you love the atmosphere that surrounds the Amsterdam Red Light District then this hotel is a great budget choice. Affordable, perfectly located for Central Station and just what we were looking for. We're a couple in our twenties - looking for fun but also a comfortable pad for a few nights together in Dam. This is a cheap place and the right side of rough and ready. The pub downstairs was always busy but not rowdy and even though our room faced out onto the street the noise never woke us up (the hotel supplies freshly packaged earplugs should you be worried!). In fact, waking up to the sounds of Amsterdam is something I loved - if you don't like the fun and games avoid the area all together but if it's all part of the atmosphere for you, this is as good a place to wake up as any. The stairs are crazily steep but traditional for this type of house and the room wasn't plush by any stretch of the imagination. But the bed was comfy enough and the sink in the room made dealing with the shared bathroom easier. Towels were supplied on the first day. The room wasn't cleaned during our stay but that's perhaps because we weren't awake when the chamber maid did her rounds. To be honest we had late nights and late morning so we never had to queue for the loo or shower. If you've ever hostelled you'll find this place better than a hostel, if you haven't hostelled you'll find it a bit rough around the edges. No complaints at all. Perhaps take your own sheets just in case you're a little more used to your own comforts than others may be.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!!”
Reviews.Author: chrisbutler83
Reviews.Content: This hotel is cheap and cheerful! I have stayed here twice now and both times found it to be exactly what I wanted. The rooms are clean, but rather spartan. Do not come here expecting The Ritz! This is basically a pub with some rooms above it, but the staff are extremely helpful and pleasant, and the bar is top notch! I would recommend this hotel to everyone I know!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here twice, great place”
Reviews.Author: Moody751
Reviews.Content: This is a safe, clean, convenient place for those not seeking luxury amenities. 2 minutes walk from Centraal train station. Check in at the pub downstairs. Friendly staff. The street noise is not too bad but bring ear plugs if you are going to sleep with windows open. Stayed two times: once with shared bath and once with private bath. Both times were excellent. Linen change daily. Security system seems top notch with cameras and key card entry. There is a safe in the pub that you can access during open hours.

Reviews.Title: “Utter Class”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Depends what you want from a trip to Amsterdam. 5 mins from the station. 5 mins from the square, near bars and red light district with a pub underneath. Yes relatively basic and the stairs aren't to be messed with if you are bit wobbly BUT we couldn't fault it. Nor could we find it at 3am but that was our fault!

Reviews.Title: “This is a good place.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a very good Hotel for our first trip to Amsterdam. It was close to the train station. It had a freindly bar. Stairs are not a problem if you travel light. It is in a very convienient central location for walking around town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: fgpolestar
Reviews.Content: A hotel right in the heart of the city of Amsterdam! The city's famous Dam, its even more famous Red Light District, and its well organised station (Amsterdam Centraal) are literally two walking minutes away. Furthermore, the hotel is surrounded by half-British-half-Dutch Pubs, Asian restaurants and Take-Away desks, and nice little restaurants. Therefore, there is little to complain about 85 EUR during the season or about 65 EUR off-season. Just don't expect any service. The rooms - though not really spacy - are clean, sheets are fresh, bathroom etc. with no problems, and you get even a small TV with both local and international programms. However, as much as the hotel's surroundings with its bars and pubs are a plus, as much they are a minus as well: it's terribly noisy there, as the old houses close to one another take up every sound. Particularly on Friday and Saturday nights, the busy area will take your sleep until the early morning - and from the early morning on, lorries with their delivery and Amsterdam's cleaning crew will keep you awake anyway. So: A nice and relatively pricy place to stay, and a perfect location to explore the heart of Amsterdam ... all you need is something to close your ears.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel last month. In one word: terrible! It's dirty, smelly, noisy etc. Furniture is very old. Some of the staff are OK, others are very unfriendly. My advice: stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here on at least 5 occasions”
Reviews.Author: Markthemover
Reviews.Content: May I start by saying that yes this Hotel is very basic, it is very clean and as others will confirm the location of this Hotel is absolutely tremendous, if you arrive via Centraal Station you will be in your room within ten minutes. Ok Amsterdam is a weekend city in the main where people come from all over the place to really enjoy themselves, this hotel caters for these people, if you want peacefull luxurious rooms to lay around in then dont come here!! I will be staying here for probably the sixth time (each time for 3 or 4 nights) in Feb 05, and I can safely say i have never had a bad time here. As for rude staff, this is ridiculous you normally get back what you put in, if you catch my drift. The bar downstairs is a public bar of the traditional (Brown Bar) standard and is a great place to start off your night. Directly over the road is a wonderful little Chinese greasy spoon type place, where tourists mix with locals alike, it is very reasonable and the food is simple but good, plus with it's favourable loaction you cant go wrong. Take a left turn out of the Hotel Bar door and take a stroll sown the very colourful Warmoestratt with leads to Dam Square or the RLD (five mins walk) . 5 star location, very reasonable, Well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In my opinion this was a great place. Not a luxury hotel, but not lacking at all. Clean, Friendly staff, New and Clean Bathrooms, very reasonable price, and the location is very close to Central Station. I will stay here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “A Balanced Opinion”
Reviews.Author: w00ks
Reviews.Content: Firstly , having stayed at Hotel Internationaal recently, i can see that the above review is accurate in detail (ie shower close to stairs, a bit noisy, beds pushed together etc) and given the above posters said treatment i can't blame them for hating the place... BUT i have a very different story. The young Irish girl and Dutch lad who were behind the bar (reception ;0) were excellent and very helpful with my mates numerous questions and offered sound advice. The place was clean, beds were comfortable, the location is second to none (literally) and the staff are friendly. You can't get much more from budget accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Internationaal - Avoid At All Cost!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was a dump - rude staff, broken toilet, leaking shower, and expensive for such a disaster it's above a pub and i think the people running it should stick to just running a pub instead of trying to fleece travellers with its substandard accomodations we (boyfriend and I) booked for 3 nights and was told that the toilet's broken but they'll fix it the next day well, they couldn't get it fixed and only refunded us 5 euros out of the 85 euros a night we paid for the room worse, the shower leaks, water runs down the stairs but wait, the worse is yet to come - the staff banged on our door and accused us of causing the leak, when we didn't have the slightest idea that it did they also accused us of using the broken toilet, when we didn't even go near it we wanted to change a room but the staff (a 40-ish woman named linda) was really rude and curtly told us they had no room and we had to live with all the crap we couldn't get out, as they made us pay upfront for the three nights on top of that, we had to put up with thin walls, so that means lots of noise and we didn't have a good rest on top of that, we paid for a double bed and what they did was just to push 2 single beds together we couldn't wait to get out of there so a sincere warning to you if u are looking for accomodation in amsterdam - beware of substandard, rude hoteliers that said, amsterdam's a really pretty place, just be careful of where u choose your accommodations, it could seriously mar your trip

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Internationaal
HotelInfo.Address: Warmoesstraat 1 - 3 | Old Side: Red Light District, Amsterdam 1012 HT, The Netherlands
